result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

3:29 PM Defendant Carrie A Larsen not in court.  Attorney Taylor O Soule in court for Carrie A Larsen.  Attorney Jedidiah J Dodge in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Court calls case.
Atty Dodge states appearances.

Defendant has transportation issues.
Parties requests hearing rescheduled.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 7, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on November 7, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

Filed by the State:  Prelim set for 10/3 @ 3:00 p.m. in Br 3 
defense attorney called asking if we could reschedule due to defendants conflict.
Preliminary hearing and Arraignment on October 3, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on October 3, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Email correspondence from DA's Office in re:  removing from court calendar as they will be filing a motion/order to dismiss the case (called and said wrong person and case-ss)
Notice of Motion and Motion for Modification of Bond filed by Atty Taylor Soule (sent to Br 1 Judge/JA on 08/10/22 sp)

2:15 PM Defendant Carrie A Larsen appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Andrew Mutchler in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Taylor O Soule in court for Carrie A Larsen. 

Attorney/Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of the charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of the complaint.
Attorney waives time limits for the preliminary hearing to be held.

Court advises defendant of right to counsel/public defender representation.

BY THE COURT:  Bond continued.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 19, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

records.addlTxt: Initial Appearance set for August 1, 2022 @ 2:00 p.m. in Br 3

Maintain absolute sobriety.. 
Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within the scope of your employment. 
Do not operate Motor Vehicle without a valid Drivers License.

1:15 PM Defendant Carrie Ann Larsen appeared by video, in custody. 
Assistant District Attorney (ADA) Brian Pfeil in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney (Atty) Maxwell Bergner is present in court.
ADA Pfeil states facts for anticipated charges of OWI 1st or 2nd, Discharge Bodily Fluids at a public safety worker. 
Atty Bergner does not have anything to state about the facts of the case.
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.
Defendant is eligible for a public defender.
Court informs defendant of right to an attorney and/or public defender.
State requests a cash bond with conditions as stated. 
Atty Bergner requests a signature bond.
Hearing scheduled for August 1, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
